titles.title: Cardfight!! Vanguard: Asia Circuit Hen
カードファイト!! ヴァンガード アジアサーキット編
CARDFIGHT!! ヴァンガード アジアサーキット編
Cardfight!! Vanguard Asia Circuit
卡片战斗先导者 亚洲巡回赛篇

anime.description: http://anidb.net/ch25900 [Aichi] and his friends have won the National Tournament and decide to go their own ways until a mysterious boy named http://anidb.net/ch43391 [Tatsunagi Takuto] appears. He reveals that the Royal Paladins, Dark Paladins, and Kagero leaders have been captured, and the only way to free Cray is for the Vanguard fighters to use a new power- Limit Break. Because the Royal Paladins lose the ability to fight, Aichi`s deck is changed to be a Gold Paladin deck. Aichi and his friends must now win the Vanguard VF Circuit if they are to learn more about the occurrences on Cray and free their old friends. Source: ANN

tag.name: shounen
tag.description: In the context of manga and associated media, shounen, literally meaning "youth" and often also specifically "boy", refers to a male audience roughly between the ages of 10 and 18. Source: Wikipedia

tag.name: target audience
tag.description: Anime, like everything else in the modern world, is targeted towards specific audiences, both implicitly by the creators and overtly by the marketing. While categories are associated with specific sex and age groups, this is not a bar on the anime being enjoyed by people who don`t fit into that band; not only do crossover titles exist, but the categories also have a considerable following outside their main demographic, and a person might as well enjoy anime from all categories. Still, does not invalidate the usefulness of marking a title as one of the categories; the same themes will likely be treated differently in anime geared for different audiences. Only one should not jump the gun and assume that a title will be more or less serious or present content in this or that way due to its target audience, or conversely assume the target audience on the content and its presentation alone. As such, the audience categories help form a broad impression of how a title might work with the announced themes, but offer little to no in-depth information about specific content or its treatment. The audience categories originate from manga magazines, which group titles of a same intended audience into a magazine that is advertised as belonging to that category, and so manga-based anime will have the category from their parent work. As for anime based on other works, the audience is often debatable, but comparing information such as time slot to the manga-based anime generally helps figure out the most likely possibility. If the parent material was classified under multiple audiences over time (for example, it was originally shounen, but then as the plot changed and became more mature, it was reclassified as seinen), and the anime adapts parent material time periods covering multiple audiences, we tag all audiences covered by the anime adaptation.

tag.name: themes
tag.description: Themes describe the very central elements important to the anime stories. They set the backdrop against which the protagonists must face their challenges. Be it School Life, present Daily Life, Military action, Cyberpunk, Law and Order detective work, Sports, or the Underworld. These are only but a few of the more typical backgrounds for anime plots. Add to that a Conspiracy setting with a possible tragic outcome, the Themes span most of the imaginable subject matter relevant to anime.

tag.name: original work
tag.description: What the anime is based on! This is given as the original work credit in the OP. Mostly of academic interest, but a useful bit of info, hinting at the possible depth of story.

tag.name: game
tag.description: Based on an interactive (even if minimally so) form of entertainment software, generally available for PCs, consoles or arcade machines.

tag.name: proxy battles
tag.description: In our terms, a proxy battle is a battle where humans use creatures/robots to do the fighting for them, either by commanding those creatures/robots or by simply evolving them/changing them into battle mode. Often the training aspect is also involved, or in some cases the proxies are nothing more than holographic representatives of some other variation of competition (like for example a card game). While many popular shounen anime fit under this category, it`s not limited to shounen anime.

tag.name: sports
tag.description: Sports anime revolves around a recreational physical activity or skill. In addition they often adhere to certain genre conventions, the emphasis on training and practice in preparation for competition, characters desire for self improvement, and pursuit of a specific goal.

tag.name: card games
tag.description: A card game is any game using playing cards as the primary device with which the game is played, be they traditional or game-specific. Countless card games exist, including families of related games (such as poker). A small number of card games played with traditional decks have formally standardized rules, but most are folk games whose rules vary by region, culture, and person. Many games that are not generally placed in the family of card games do in fact use cards for some aspect of their gameplay. Similarly, some games that are placed in the card game genre involve a board. The distinction is that the gameplay of a card game primarily depends on the use of the cards by players (the board is simply a guide for scorekeeping or for card placement), while board games (the principal non-card game genre to use cards) generally focus on the players` positions on the board, and use the cards for some secondary purpose.

character.name: Akumu no Kuni no Cheshire Cat
Akumu no Kuni no March Rabbit

episode.title: 発動!リミットブレイク!!
Activate! Limit Break!
Hatsudou! Limit Break!!
episode.summary: Aichi`s stuck with Gold Paladin, a deck he knows nothing about, and no one seems to remember his Royal Paladin deck. Aichi battles his last hope, Kai, in an attempt to jog his memory! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 金色の騎士団(ゴールドパラディン)
Gold Paladin
Gold Paladin
episode.summary: Aichi plays against a mysterious boy with a new deck, Gold Paladin, and hears a story about the state of peril on the planet Cray! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: チームQ4再び
Team Q4 Returns
Team Q4 Futatabi
episode.summary: Team Q4 has been invited to go to the Vanguard Fight Circuit, but who will the members be? Aichi and Misaki are on board, but Kamui has already joined Team Handsome! Is there any way Aichi can persuade Kamui to come back to Q4?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: PSYからの挑戦状
Challenge from PSY
PSY kara no Chousenjou
episode.summary: Aichi goes with Misaki and Kamui to Card Shop PSY to ask the owners if they know anything about his suddenly-switched deck. Rekka, Kourin, and Suika are about to go on a trip, but Rekka finds time to taunt Team Q4 for letting their skills stagnate since the national tournament... and to prove it, Rekka debuts her Angel Feather deck as she takes on Misaki! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 開幕! VFサーキット!!
VF Circuit Begins!
Kaimaku! VF Circuit!!
episode.summary: Team Q4 arrives in Singapore for the VF Circuit! While doing a little sightseeing, they run into old friends and meet potential new rivals. Then, Aichi happens to spot the boy who knows what happened to his Royal Paladin deck, but he`s not allowed to get anywhere near the kid! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: エリートの誇り
Pride of the Elite
Elite no Hokori
episode.summary: Two of the matches between Team Q4 and Team SIT Genius are concluded, while the third is unexpectedly (and temporarily) interrupted by something that`s out of this world! Meanwhile, will Kamui`s love for Emi be broadcast worldwide?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 女神を賭けて!
Bet on the Goddess!
Megami o Kakete!
episode.summary: It`s the third round of the Vanguard Fight Circuit, and Team Q4 is pitted against the Wunderkinder of Team SIT Genius, who not only have a natural aptitude for Vanguard, but were raised on it! Does Team Q4 stand a chance...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 占いファイト!
Fortune-Telling Fight
Uranai Fight!
episode.summary: Team Q4 proceeds to the second round, where they fight against a team of fortune-tellers! Will Zeichiku spook Kamui with a curse? Will Misaki be thrown by the arrogant affection of Horoscope? And will Aichi be bested by an opponent who has a crystal ball on his head?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 限界を超える獅子
The Lion That Exceeds Its Limits
Genkai o Koeru Shishi
episode.summary: Kamui has won his match, so now it`s up to either Aichi, Misaki or both to best their ninja opponents, who are much more worldly than Team Q4. What effect will Aichi`s new card have on the match?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 参上! チーム忍
Team Shinobi Is Here!
Sanjou! Team Shinobi
episode.summary: The Vanguard Fight Circuit begins with Aichi, Kamui, and Misaki playing their matches simultaneously! Their first opponents: the world-traveling ninjas, Team Shinobi! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: テツ現る
Tetsu Appears
Tetsu Arawaru
episode.summary: Tetsu comes to Card Capital, but why? Is it just to challenge Team Q4 and anyone else who happens to be there? Or could his coming portend something more serious? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 雪原の挑戦者
Snowfield Challenger
Setsugen no Chousensha
episode.summary: Kai arrives in the Japanese Alps to do battle against the Abominable Snowman, who`s taken down one famous Vanguard challenger after another. But why does the Snowman seem to bear malice towards Kai before they even get started...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天才降臨
Genius`s Descent
Tensai Kourin
episode.summary: The power of Psyqualia is back, and this time Chris, the leader of Team SIT Genius, possesses it! Can Aichi beat this new rival with skill alone?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 熱狂のソウルステージ
Feverish Seoul Stage
Nekkyou no Seoul Stage
episode.summary: It`s the first match of the Seoul stage, but complicating matters for Team Q4 is the unique special rule in play for each match! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 驚愕の新メンバー
Shocking New Member
Kyougaku no Shin Member
episode.summary: It`s Team Q4 versus New AL4, and the new member is Kai! Old rivalries are revisited, former teammmates are now opponents, and another mystical intervention occurs! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 騎士たちの再戦
Rematch of the Knights
Kishi-tachi no Saisen
episode.summary: It`s Aichi`s first rematch with Ren since beating him at nationals, and the power of Psyqualia is back, too! Ren saw himself winning the match on the planet Cray. Will Aichi be able to keep the prophecy from coming true?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 勇者の挑戦
Hero`s Challenge
Yuusha no Chousen
episode.summary: Team Q4 has been defeated in the Seoul stage, but the final round is between New AL4 and Team Caesar. Will Kenji Mitsusada avenge himself after being thoroughly trounced by Ren at the national tournament in Japan? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 伝説のファイター
Legendary Fighter
Densetsu no Fighter
episode.summary: Weird things always happen when Aichi and the gang visit PSY, and this time is no different. Legendary Cardfighter Daigo apparently appears out of nowhere with a long-lost Royal Paladin deck. Nasty newcomer Leon also makes his debut with Aqua Force, another legendary deck! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 常夏への招待状
Invitation to Everlasting Summer
Tokonatsu e no Shoutaijou
episode.summary: When Team Q4 arrives on a resort island to relax while they train, they discover it`s cohabited by New AL4! Is one island big enough for these two rival teams?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: それぞれの夏
Each One`s Summer Vacation
Sorezore no Natsu
episode.summary: On the resort island, Aichi struggles alone with how he should "move forward." Ren borrows another deck and uses it to fight Misaki. And when Kamui feels down after losing repeatedly to Tetsu, it`s Eiji and Reiji to the rescue! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 男前ファイト!光定VSゴウキ
Handsome Fight! Mitsusada vs. Gouki
Otokomae Fight! Mitsusada vs. Gouki
episode.summary: For some reason, Mitsusada is looking for Aichi, who`s busy battling it out with Kamui at a tournament at Card Shop Handsome. So, instead of waiting around, Mitsusada has a cardfight with another top-class fighter: Gouki! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 燃えよ!香港ステージ
Burn! Hong Kong Stage!
Moeyo! Hong Kong Stage
episode.summary: A new country! New rules! New opponents! In the first match of the Hong Kong stage, Team Q4 has a tag team fight against brothers whose teamwork is second to none! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 最強! タッグファイト
Strongest Tag Fight!
Saikyou! Tag Fight
episode.summary: The tag team battle between Q4 and Team Lao heats up! Will Aichi and Misaki figure out how to fight as partners in time, or will they be crushed by the Dinodragons of the brothers Lao?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 出撃!伝説の艦隊
Raid! Legendary Armada!
Shutsugeki! Densetsu no Kantai
episode.summary: In the final round of the Hong Kong stage, Aichi and Kamui fight Team Aqua; then, along the way, Aichi learns about Leon`s connection to the planet Cray! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: The[ざっ]・草[そう]・魂[だましい]!!
The Weed Soul!
Zassou Damashii!!
episode.summary: Kamui finally takes a turn in the Hong Kong tag team tournament. But is he really ready to face the Battle Weeds, a team that keeps coming back no matter how many times they`re stepped on?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蒼嵐龍メイルストローム
Blue Storm Dragon, Maelstrom
Souranryuu Maelstrom
episode.summary: It`s the stunning conclusion of the Hong Kong stage, with Team Q4 in a tag team battle against Leon`s Team Dreadnought! Aichi finally uses his Psyqualia to counter the effect of Leon`s, but will he be strong enough?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: Q4VSウルトラレア
Q4 vs. Ultra-Rare
Q4 vs. Ultra-Rare
episode.summary: Team Q4 needs to get stronger to have any chance of winning the final stage of the circuit. Ultra-rare agrees to fight Q4, and Aichi is up first. But Kourin has her own reasons for fighting Aichi that have nothing to do with training him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 集いし勝者たち
Gathering of Winners
Tsudoishi Shousha-tachi
episode.summary: Kyou is back, this time with a new deck that "bugs" his shanghaied opponent, Leon! And if Kyou wins, will his team replace Team Dreadnought for the final leg of the Asian Circuit...?! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 天使たちの舞い
Angels` Dance
Tenshi-tachi no Mai
episode.summary: The battle against Ultra-rare continues! When hothead Kamui fights cucumber-cool Suiko, will he crack under pressure?! Meanwhile, Misaki`s gotten strong enough to deserve a rematch with Rekka... but Rekka`s gotten stronger, too! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 集結! 日本ステージ
Assemble! Japan Stage!
Shuuketsu! Nihon Stage
episode.summary: The Japan stage begins! And its winner will go on to the final stage to fight the previous VF Circuit champions. But who are the powerful masked members of Team Unknown, the team that must also be beaten in order to proceed to the final stage...? Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 決戦! ブライダルファイト
Decisive Battle! Bridal Fight!
Kessen! Bridal Fight
episode.summary: At the Japan stage, Kamui must once again face the bane of his existence, Nagisa... who`s set not only on winning, but on marrying Kamui! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 王からの挑戦状
Challenge from the King
Ou kara no Chousenjou
episode.summary: Team Unknown is finally unmasked, and while the identities of two of them will come as no surprise... the enigmatic King Z is a different story! At any rate, to actually win the final Japan stage, Team Q4 must beat X, Y, and Z! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 新たなる輝き!
A New Brilliance!
Aratanaru Kagayaki!
episode.summary: In the last round of the Vanguard Fight Circuit, both Misaki and Kamui have to win their battles against Team Unknown to take the final Japan stage! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風の真実
The Truth of the Wind
Kaze no Shinjitsu
episode.summary: It`s not just a game anymore! The fate of two worlds hangs in the balance as Aichi, Kamui, and Misaki embark on a desperate mission to defeat Leon Souryu! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光輝の獅子
Luminous Lion
Kouki no Shishi
episode.summary: Two worlds are in peril... but before tackling that problem, Aichi chooses to fight Chris to save him from the dark side of Psyqualia! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 蒼龍レオン
Leon Souryu
Souryuu Leon
episode.summary: It`s Kai versus Leon in limbo! Can Kai save the Earth, Cray, and the lost clans? It`s a tall order, especially since Kai doesn`t possess Psyqualia. Plus, learn the ultimate secrets of Leon and his people! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風の審判
Judgment of the Wind
Kaze no Shinpan
episode.summary: It`s the senses-staggering conclusion of the battle between Kai and Leon in limbo! Kai may not be backed up by the power of Void, but he`s inspired by Aichi and determined to win! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 光と虚無
Light and Nothingness
Hikari to Kyomu
episode.summary: The penultimate episode of the Asia Circuit arc! Aichi is in heated battle with Leon, even as the pitch-black power of nothingness surrounds him! Source: crunchyroll

episode.title: 風のゆくえ
Whereabouts of the Wind
Kaze no Yukue
episode.summary: In the final episode of the Asia Circuit arc, Aichi battles Leon, even as the very space around them collapses! Will Void consume two worlds as well as everything in between?! Source: crunchyroll
